description: [Status: preview] [Name: write-whole-file] [Message: Path.open() followed by write() can be replaced by {filename}.{suggestion}] What it does Checks for uses of open and write that can be replaced by pathlib methods, like Path.write_text and Path.write_bytes. Why is this bad? When writing a single string to a file, it's simpler and more concise to use pathlib methods like Path.write_text and Path.write_bytes instead of open and write calls via with statements. Example with open("file.txt", "w") as f: f.write("some text") Use instead: from pathlib import Path Path("file.txt").write_text("some text") Fix Safety This rule's fix is marked as unsafe if the replacement would remove comments attached to the original expression.
